title: The Noise
text:
the Noise was a monthly <a href="newspaper">newspaper</a> serving the cities of <a href="Flagstaff%2C%20Arizona">Flagstaff</a>, <a href="Prescott%2C%20Arizona">Prescott</a>, <a href="Sedona%2C%20Arizona">Sedona</a>, <a href="Cottonwood%2C%20Arizona">Cottonwood</a>, <a href="Jerome%2C%20Arizona">Jerome</a>, <a href="Clarkdale%2C%20Arizona">Clarkdale</a>, and <a href="Winslow%2C%20Arizona">Winslow</a> in northern <a href="Arizona">Arizona</a>. Founded in 1993 by four high school seniors whose rural hometown's budget cuts lead to the cancellation of the student newspaper, it has since expanded its circulation and editorial to encompass a large swath of northern Arizona. The last issue of the Noise ran in December 2017.
As an independent <a href="nonprofit">nonprofit</a> publication, the Noise contained a variety of <a href="news">news</a>, <a href="arts">arts</a>, <a href="music">music</a>, <a href="poetry">poetry</a>, <a href="fiction">fiction</a> and commentary.
It had housed in-depth coverage of the controversial issue of <a href="snowmaking">snowmaking</a> on the <a href="San%20Francisco%20Peaks">San Francisco Peaks</a> by <a href="Arizona%20Snowbowl">Arizona Snowbowl</a> and the subsequent appeal from <a href="Native%20Americans%20in%20the%20United%20States">Native American</a> tribes to the <a href="Ninth%20Circuit%20Court%20of%20Appeals">Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals</a>. It has also covered issues such as water rights, education reform, affordable housing, and immigration law.
